title: Bug: rs.AddText() is missing option to set "Style"
question:
In I script where I use rs.AddText() I get the wrong height since I can not set “Default” as Dimension style.

It defaults to use “Millimeter Small” which is a 1:10 scale so an option for this is needed asap please.


-J

code_blocks.code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
import scriptcontext as sc

rs.AddDimStyle("no_scale_ref_style")
ref_style=sc.doc.DimStyles.Find("no_scale_ref_style",True)
ref_style.DimensionScale=1.0
rs.CurrentDimStyle("no_scale_ref_style")
origin=rs.coerce3dpoint([0,0,0])
rs.AddText("Test",origin,10.0,"Arial",0,1+65536)
